com.henrikhedberg.hbdp.server

Class HbdpConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.henrikhedberg.hbdp.server.HbdpConnection

  • public class HbdpConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    HTTP Bidirectional Protocol (HBDP) server-side connection.

    The HbdpServer instantiates one connection for each incoming session. When a HbdpConnection.Handler receive a new connection, it should take the InputStream with the getInputStream() method and the OutputStream with the getOutputStream() method. Optionally, it can also register a InputStreamHandler, which is called when the InputStream has new bytes available.

    Version:
    1.0 (20150503)
    Author:
    Henrik Hedberg <henrik.hedberg@iki.fi>

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  HbdpConnection.Handler
      An interface to notify a handler that a new HBDP connection (session) is established.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getIdentifier()
      Returns the session identifier for this connection.
      java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
      Returns the underlying InputStream that is used to read bytes received from the HBDP session.
      java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
      Returns the underlying OutputStream that is used to write bytes to be transmit through the HBDP session.
      void setInputStreamHandler(InputStreamHandler handler)
      Sets optional InputStreamHandler, which is called when the underlying InputStream has new bytes available.
